title: Standard Calibrations and Prediction for Thermal Gradients during In Situ Transmission Electron Microscopy Heating Experiments
content: In situ transmission electron microscopy (TEM) has made significant progress in recent years, enabling high-resolution observations of materials under conditions closely resembling their real-world application environments [1]. This advancement has provided invaluable insights into the relationship between materials' microstructure and properties at elevated temperatures in real time. Utilizing microelectromechanical system (MEMS)-type microheaters [2, 3], precise control over local temperatures during in-situ TEM experiments has become achievable. However, conventional use of the heating setups was limited to providing homogeneous temperature distributions over the area of interest [4].
